label: Arms
short_description: The muscles of the upper limb responsible for elbow and wrist movement.
function: Flexion and extension of the elbow and wrist joints.
location: Upper limb, from the shoulder joint down to the wrist.
triggers: Bending or straightening the elbows; gripping or curling.

label: Back
short_description: The large musculature of the posterior torso.
function: Pulling, rowing, and stabilizing the spine and scapula.
location: Posterior torso, spanning from the base of the neck to the pelvis.
triggers: Pulling resistance toward the body; extending the spine.

label: Chest
short_description: The primary pushing muscles of the anterior torso.
function: Pushing outward and bringing the arms across the midline of the body (adduction).
location: Anterior upper torso, covering the ribcage.
triggers: Pushing resistance away from the body; hugging or arcing motions.

label: Core
short_description: The stabilizing center of the body.
function: Spinal flexion, rotation, and maintaining rigid torso stability.
location: The midsection, wrapping around the front and sides of the waist.
triggers: Planking, crunching, twisting, or bracing against heavy loads.

label: Legs
short_description: The primary movers of the lower body.
function: Squatting, hinging, walking, and jumping.
location: The lower limb, from the hip joint down to the ankles.
triggers: Pushing against the floor; bending the knees; extending the hips.

label: Shoulders
short_description: The highly mobile muscles capping the shoulder joint.
function: Raising the arms overhead, forward, or to the sides; rotating the arm.
location: The top and lateral sides of the upper torso/arm intersection.
triggers: Pressing vertically overhead; raising the arms laterally or frontally.

label: Neck
short_description: The muscles supporting and articulating the head.
function: Head flexion, extension, and lateral rotation.
location: Cervical spine area, above the collarbone and upper traps.
triggers: Nodding the head forward or lifting the head backward.

label: Full Body
short_description: Systemic movements engaging the entire muscular system.
function: Maximum force production and systemic energy expenditure.
location: The entire skeletal musculature.
triggers: Olympic lifting, heavily loaded carries, or explosive plyometrics.

label: Biceps
short_description: The primary pulling muscles of the upper arm.
function: Flexing the elbow and supinating the forearm.
location: Anterior portion of the upper arm.
triggers: Curling weights upward; underhand pulling.

label: Forearms
short_description: The muscles controlling the wrist and grip.
function: Wrist flexion, extension, and finger gripping.
location: The lower arm, between the elbow and the wrist.
triggers: Heavy gripping, holding static weight, or wrist curls.

label: Triceps
short_description: The primary pushing muscles of the upper arm.
function: Straightening (extending) the elbow joint.
location: Posterior portion of the upper arm.
triggers: Pressing weight away; extending the arm downward or overhead.

label: Lats
short_description: The widest muscle of the back, creating a V-taper.
function: Pulling the arm down toward the pelvis and extending the shoulder.
location: Mid-to-lower lateral back, wrapping around the sides.
triggers: Vertical pulling (e.g., pull-ups) and horizontal rowing.

label: Upper Lats
short_description: The upper fibers of the lats near the armpit.
function: Shoulder adduction from a wide angle.
location: The top portion of the latissimus dorsi, pulling horizontally.
triggers: Wide-grip pulldowns and high rows.

label: Lower Lats
short_description: The sweeping lower fibers of the lats.
function: Shoulder extension and adduction from an overhead angle.
location: The sweeping lower portion of the latissimus dorsi, attaching to the pelvis.
triggers: Underhand pulldowns, narrow grip rows, and pullovers.

label: Lower Back
short_description: The supportive muscles along the lower spine.
function: Extending the spine and maintaining upright posture.
location: Lower lumbar region, just above the pelvis.
triggers: Deadlifting, hyperextensions, and maintaining a hinged stance.

label: Mid Back
short_description: The central muscles responsible for back thickness.
function: Retracting the shoulder blades (pulling them together).
location: The center of the back, between the shoulder blades.
triggers: Horizontal rowing and pulling the elbows far behind the torso.

label: Traps
short_description: The diamond-shaped muscle spanning the neck to the mid-back.
function: Elevating, depressing, and retracting the scapula.
location: Upper back, extending up to the neck and down to the mid-spine.
triggers: Shrugging, upright rowing, and stabilizing overhead presses.

label: Upper Back
short_description: The upper structural muscles supporting the rear shoulders.
function: Stabilizing the upper spine and supporting rear shoulder movement.
location: The upper thoracic region, spanning the upper shoulder blades.
triggers: High rows, face pulls, and wide-grip horizontal pulls.

label: Lower Chest
short_description: The lower margin of the pectoral muscle.
function: Pressing downward and adduction from a high angle.
location: The bottom edge of the pectoral muscles along the lower ribs.
triggers: Decline bench presses and high-to-low cable flys.

label: Mid Chest
short_description: The main bulk of the pectoral muscle.
function: Straight horizontal pressing and strict adduction.
location: The central mass of the chest, connecting to the sternum.
triggers: Flat bench presses and mid-level chest flys.

label: Upper Chest
short_description: The upper margin bridging the chest to the front deltoids.
function: Pressing upward and lifting the arms across the body.
location: The top of the chest, located just below the collarbone.
triggers: Incline bench presses and low-to-high scoop flys.

label: Abs
short_description: The segmented muscle responsible for the six-pack look.
function: Flexing the lumbar spine (crunching the torso).
location: The center of the stomach, from the ribcage to the pelvis.
triggers: Crunches, sit-ups, and leg raises.

label: Hip Flexors
short_description: The deep muscles linking the lower spine to the legs.
function: Bringing the knees up toward the chest (hip flexion).
location: Deep within the front of the hip and lower abdomen.
triggers: Hanging leg raises, high knees, and sit-ups.

label: Obliques
short_description: The diagonal muscles controlling torso rotation.
function: Rotating the torso and bending sideways.
location: The sides of the waist and lower ribcage.
triggers: Russian twists, woodchops, and side bends.

label: Calves
short_description: The muscles on the back of the lower leg.
function: Plantarflexion (pointing the toes/lifting the heels).
location: The posterior portion of the lower leg.
triggers: Standing or seated heel raises; jumping.

label: Shins
short_description: The muscles on the front of the lower leg.
function: Dorsiflexion (pulling the toes up toward the knee).
location: The anterior portion of the lower leg, next to the shinbone.
triggers: Toe raises, walking backwards, heel walking.

label: Glutes
short_description: The largest, most powerful muscle group in the body.
function: Extending the hip, thrusting the pelvis forward, and hip abduction.
location: The buttocks.
triggers: Hip thrusts, deep squats, and deadlifts.

label: Hamstrings
short_description: The pulling muscles of the lower body.
function: Bending the knee (flexion) and assisting in hip extension.
location: The posterior aspect of the thigh.
triggers: Leg curls and stiff-legged deadlifts (RDLs).

label: Inner Thighs
short_description: The muscles pulling the legs together.
function: Hip adduction (pulling the femurs toward the midline).
location: The medial (inside) portion of the thigh.
triggers: Sumo squats, lateral lunges, and adductor machines.

label: Outer Hips/Thighs
short_description: The muscles pushing the legs apart.
function: Hip abduction (pushing the femurs away from the midline).
location: The lateral (outside) portion of the hips and upper thigh.
triggers: Abductor machines and lateral banded walks.

label: Quads
short_description: The pushing muscles of the lower body.
function: Straightening the knee (extension).
location: The anterior (front) aspect of the thigh.
triggers: Leg extensions, forward lunges, and front squats.

label: Front Delts
short_description: The front segment of the shoulder.
function: Raising the arms directly forward and assisting in pressing.
location: The front of the shoulder joint, tying into the upper chest.
triggers: Front raises and overhead pressing.

label: Rear Delts
short_description: The back segment of the shoulder.
function: Pulling the arms backward horizontally (transverse abduction).
location: The back of the shoulder joint, tying into the upper back.
triggers: Reverse flys and face pulls.

label: Side Delts
short_description: The middle segment of the shoulder, creating width.
function: Raising the arms straight out to the sides (abduction).
location: The outermost, lateral cap of the shoulder joint.
triggers: Lateral raises and upright rows.

label: Outer Bicep
short_description: The outer head responsible for the bicep peak.
function: Elbow flexion and forearm supination, especially when stretched.
location: The lateral (outer) side of the anterior upper arm.
triggers: Curls performed with elbows behind the torso or with a narrow grip.

label: Inner Bicep
short_description: The inner head adding width and mass to the arm.
function: Elbow flexion and forceful supination.
location: The medial (inner) side of the anterior upper arm.
triggers: Preacher curls, wide grips, and elbows in front of the torso.

label: Brachialis
short_description: A deep muscle that pushes the bicep up, making the arm look thicker.
function: Pure elbow flexion, regardless of forearm rotation.
location: Deep beneath the lower bicep, bridging to the forearm.
triggers: Hammer curls and reverse curls.

label: Inner Tricep
short_description: The largest head of the tricep, crossing the shoulder joint.
function: Elbow extension and shoulder adduction/extension.
location: The posterior, medial side of the upper arm, closest to the body.
triggers: Overhead extensions or extensions maximizing the stretch.

label: Outer Tricep
short_description: The highly visible head forming the outside of the horseshoe.
function: Strong elbow extension.
location: The lateral (outer) aspect of the posterior upper arm.
triggers: Pushdowns or pressing with the arms kept firmly at the sides.

label: Deep Tricep
short_description: The stabilizing head active in all extension movements.
function: Base stabilization during elbow extension.
location: Deep to the long and lateral heads, near the elbow.
triggers: Heavy lockout pressing and strict pushdowns.

label: Top Forearm
short_description: The muscles opening the hand and raising the knuckles.
function: Extending the wrist and fingers.
location: The dorsal (top) side of the lower arm.
triggers: Reverse curls and wrist extensions.

label: Bottom Forearm
short_description: The muscles responsible for crushing grip strength.
function: Flexing the wrist and closing the fingers tightly.
location: The palmar (bottom) side of the lower arm.
triggers: Wrist curls, heavy deadlifts, and farmer's carries.

label: Outer Forearm
short_description: A prominent forearm muscle that heavily assists the bicep.
function: Bending the elbow when the hand is in a neutral or pronated grip.
location: The upper, lateral ridge of the forearm, crossing the elbow.
triggers: Hammer curls and neutral-grip pull-ups.

label: Rhomboids
short_description: Deep muscles responsible for strict scapular control.
function: Squeezing the shoulder blades together strongly.
location: Deep to the trapezius, connecting the spine to the scapula.
triggers: Strict horizontal pulling and reverse flys.

label: Upper Traps
short_description: The highly visible neck and shoulder muscles.
function: Elevating the scapula (shrugging) and extending the neck.
location: Sloping from the base of the skull down to the shoulders.
triggers: Heavy shrugs and farmer's carries.

label: Mid Traps
short_description: The thick center of the upper back.
function: Retracting the scapula (pulling shoulders back).
location: Between the upper shoulder blades.
triggers: Wide-grip rows and reverse flys.

label: Lower Traps
short_description: Crucial postural muscles for shoulder health.
function: Depressing the scapula (pulling the shoulders downward).
location: The middle back, running down along the thoracic spine.
triggers: Y-Raises, reverse decline flys, and strict pulldowns.

label: Teres Major
short_description: A thick muscle that acts as the little helper to the lats.
function: Internal rotation, adduction, and extension of the humerus.
location: Just above the lats, sitting under the armpit and rear delt.
triggers: Wide grip pulldowns and straight-arm pulldowns.

label: Pectoralis Minor
short_description: A deep chest muscle that influences shoulder posture.
function: Draws the scapula forward and downward.
location: Deep beneath the upper pectoralis major.
triggers: Dips, pullovers, and deep fly stretches.

label: Inner Quad
short_description: The teardrop-shaped stabilizer just above the knee.
function: Knee extension and patellar (kneecap) stabilization.
location: The medial (inner) lower portion of the front thigh.
triggers: Leg extensions with toes pointed slightly outward; cyclist squats.

label: Outer Quad
short_description: The large outer muscle giving the thigh its sweep.
function: Powerful knee extension.
location: The lateral (outer) portion of the front thigh.
triggers: Narrow stance squats, leg press, or extensions with toes pointed inward.

label: Mid Quad
short_description: The central quad muscle that also crosses the hip joint.
function: Knee extension combined with hip flexion.
location: The center mass of the front thigh.
triggers: Sissy squats, standard leg extensions, and high knees.

label: Deep Quad
short_description: The unseen base muscle of the quadriceps.
function: Foundational knee extension.
location: Deep beneath the rectus femoris.
triggers: Any heavy squatting or pressing motion.

label: Outer Hamstring
short_description: The lateral pulling muscle of the back thigh.
function: Knee flexion and lateral hip rotation.
location: The outer posterior aspect of the thigh.
triggers: Leg curls with feet turned slightly outward.

label: Inner Hamstring
short_description: The medial pulling muscle of the back thigh.
function: Knee flexion and medial hip rotation.
location: The inner posterior aspect of the thigh.
triggers: Leg curls with feet turned slightly inward.

label: Gluteus Maximus
short_description: The primary mass and power engine of the hips.
function: Powerful hip extension and external rotation.
location: The main, visible mass of the buttocks.
triggers: Heavy hip thrusts and deep back squats.

label: Gluteus Medius
short_description: The crucial stabilizer for single-leg movements and pelvic level.
function: Hip abduction and pelvic stabilization.
location: The upper, lateral portion of the hips.
triggers: Lateral banded walks, abduction machines, and single-leg squats.

label: Gluteus Minimus
short_description: The deepest gluteal muscle.
function: Hip abduction and internal rotation.
location: Deep beneath the gluteus medius.
triggers: Seated abduction and internal rotation exercises.

label: Adductor Magnus
short_description: The largest inner thigh muscle, heavily involved in deep squats.
function: Hip adduction and assistance in hip extension.
location: The bulk of the inner thigh.
triggers: Deep sumo squats and heavy adductor machine work.

label: Upper Abs
short_description: The top segments of the abdominal wall.
function: Flexing the upper torso toward the pelvis.
location: The top portion of the stomach, just below the sternum.
triggers: Standard crunches and cable crunches.

label: Lower Abs
short_description: The bottom segments of the abdominal wall.
function: Pulling the pelvis upward toward the ribcage.
location: The lower portion of the stomach, above the groin.
triggers: Hanging leg raises and reverse crunches.

label: Middle Abs
short_description: The central stabilizing segments of the abdominal wall.
function: Core bracing and trunk stabilization.
location: The direct center of the stomach.
triggers: Isometric holds (planks) and full sit-ups.

label: Upper Obliques
short_description: Rotational muscles tied closely to the ribcage.
function: Twisting the upper torso diagonally.
location: The upper sides of the waist, overlying the lower ribs.
triggers: High-to-low cable woodchops and twisting crunches.

label: Lower Obliques
short_description: Rotational muscles controlling the pelvis.
function: Pelvic rotation and lateral spinal flexion.
location: The lower sides of the waist, above the hips.
triggers: Side bends and low-to-high woodchops.

label: Deep Core
short_description: The deepest core muscle, acting as a natural weight belt.
function: Pulling the abdominal wall inward; forceful exhalation.
location: Wrapping horizontally around the entire midsection.
triggers: Stomach vacuums and heavy intra-abdominal bracing.

label: Serratus
short_description: The finger-like muscles sitting on the upper ribs.
function: Protracting the scapula (punching forward) and upward rotation.
location: The side of the ribcage, wrapping under the armpit.
triggers: Push-up plus, ab wheel rollouts, and pullovers.

label: Rotator Cuff
short_description: The group of deep muscles stabilizing the shoulder joint.
function: Keeping the head of the humerus firmly within the shoulder socket.
location: Deep beneath the deltoids and on the scapula.
triggers: External/Internal rotations and heavy overhead stability.

label: Supraspinatus
short_description: The most frequently injured rotator cuff muscle.
function: Initiates arm abduction (the first 15 degrees).
location: Top of the shoulder blade, running under the AC joint.
triggers: Empty can raises and light lateral raise initiations.

label: Infraspinatus
short_description: The primary external rotator of the shoulder.
function: Rotating the arm outward.
location: The main flat surface of the shoulder blade.
triggers: Cable external rotations and face pulls.

label: Teres Minor
short_description: Assists the infraspinatus in rotation and stability.
function: External rotation and adduction of the humerus.
location: Just below the infraspinatus on the shoulder blade.
triggers: Banded external rotations.

label: Subscapularis
short_description: The hidden rotator cuff muscle on the front of the scapula.
function: Powerful internal rotation of the arm.
location: Sandwiched between the ribcage and the shoulder blade.
triggers: Cable internal rotations.

label: Inner Calf
short_description: The larger, medial belly of the upper calf.
function: Explosive plantarflexion (lifting the heel).
location: The inside portion of the upper lower leg.
triggers: Standing calf raises with toes pointed slightly outward.

label: Outer Calf
short_description: The outer belly creating calf width.
function: Plantarflexion and ankle stabilization.
location: The outside portion of the upper lower leg.
triggers: Standing calf raises with toes pointed slightly inward.

label: Lower Calf
short_description: The endurance muscle sitting beneath the gastroc.
function: Plantarflexion when the knee is bent.
location: The lower half of the calf, down to the Achilles tendon.
triggers: Seated calf raises or bent-knee standing raises.
